00018         class function_type::function_type_impl : public type::type_impl
00019         {
00020         public:
00021                 function_type_impl(deleg_generic_invoke inv, bool isMethod, type* rt, type** arguments, int argc)
00022                         : type_impl(isMethod ? T_METHOD : T_FUNCTION, ARCH_FUNCTION, 0)
00023                         , m_invoker(inv)
00024                         , m_retType(rt)
00025                         , m_argc(argc)
00026                 {
00027                         ASSERT_STRICT(rt);
00028                         for(int i = 0; i < argc; ++i)
00029                         {
00030                                 ASSERT_STRICT(arguments[i]);
00031                         }
00032 
00033                         memcpy(m_argTypes, arguments, sizeof(void*) * argc);
00034                 }
00035 
00036                 virtual void print_name() const
00037                 {
00038                         stack_string<> buf;
00039 
00040                         *buf += m_retType->name();
00041                         *buf += ' ';
00042 
00043                         if(tag() == T_METHOD)
00044                         {
00045                                 *buf += m_argTypes[0]->name();
00046                                 buf->resize(buf->size() - 1);
00047                                 *buf += "::*";
00048                         }
00049                         
00050                         *buf += '(';
00051 
00052                         for(size_t i = tag() == T_METHOD ? 1 : 0; i != m_argc; ++i) 
00053                         {
00054                                 *buf += m_argTypes[i]->name();
00055                                 if(i != m_argc - 1)
00056                                         *buf += ", ";
00057                         }
00058 
00059                         *buf += ')';
00060                         
00061                         set_name(buf->c_str());
00062                 }
00063 
00064                 type* return_type() const
00065                 {
00066                         return m_retType;
00067                 }
00068 
00069                 size_t argument_count() const
00070                 {
00071                         return m_argc;
00072                 }
00073 
00074                 type** argument_types() const
00075                 {
00076                         return (type**)m_argTypes;
00077                 }
00078 
00079                 void invoke(void* deleg, void** args, void* result) const
00080                 {
00081                         m_invoker(deleg, args, result);
00082                 }
00083 
00084         private:
00085                 deleg_generic_invoke    m_invoker;
00086                 type*                                   m_retType;
00087                 type*                                   m_argTypes[DELEG_MAX_INVOKE_PARAMS];
00088                 size_t                                  m_argc;
00089         };

00095         function_type::function_type(deleg_generic_invoke inv, bool isMethod, type* rt, type** arguments, int argc)
00096                 : type(new function_type_impl(inv, isMethod, rt, arguments, argc))
00097         {
00098                 m_impl = static_cast<function_type_impl*>(type::m_impl);
00099         }

00124         void function_type::invoke(void *deleg, void **args, void *result) const
00125         {
00126                 m_impl->invoke(deleg, args, result);
00127         }

00131         bool function_type::equal(const type* other) const
00132         {
00133                 if(!type::equal(other))
00134                         return false;
00135                 const function_type* ft = static_cast<const function_type*>(other);
00136                 
00137                 if(argument_count() != ft->argument_count() || !return_type()->equal(ft->return_type()))
00138                         return false;
00139 
00140                 type** args1 = argument_types();
00141                 type** args2 = ft->argument_types();
00142 
00143                 for(size_t i = 0; i != argument_count(); ++i)
00144                         if(!args1[i]->equal(args2[i]))
00145                                 return false;
00146 
00147                 return true;
00148         }
